cards.name: Blastoderm
cards.text:
Shroud (This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

Fading 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
cards.originalText:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

Fading 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)

cards.name: Corrupt
cards.text: Corrupt deals damage equal to the number of Swamps you control to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
cards.originalText: Corrupt deals damage equal to the number of Swamps you control to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
cards.flavor: There are things beneath the murk for whom the bog is a stew, a thin broth in need of meat.

rulings.text: The swamps are counted on resolution.
The life you gain is equal to the damage dealt by Corrupt, not necessarily to the number of Swamps you control (if some or all of the damage is prevented, for example).

The amount of damage dealt to a creature is not bounded by its toughness, and the amount of damage dealt to a player is not bounded by that player's life total. For example, if Corrupt deals 6 damage to a 2/2 creature, you'll gain 6 life.
Corrupt counts any land you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

cards.name: Deathgreeter
cards.text: Whenever another creature dies, you may gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: Whenever another creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: "The bones of allies grant wisdom. The bones of enemies grant strength. The bones of dragons grant life eternal."

cards.name: Drudge Skeletons
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.originalText: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons.
cards.flavor:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, never surrender, and don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."

—Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook

cards.name: Elephant Guide
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.

When enchanted creature dies, put a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.

When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard, put a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Nature's strength outlives the strong.

rulings.text: If cast targeting an opponent's creature, you get the Elephant when that creature goes to the graveyard.

cards.name: Enslave
cards.text:
Enchant creature

You control enchanted creature.

At the beginning of your upkeep, enchanted creature deals 1 damage to its owner.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature

You control enchanted creature.

At the beginning of your upkeep, enchanted creature deals 1 damage to its owner.

rulings.text: The owner of a card is the player who started the game with that card in his or her deck. If the card didn't start the game in a deck, its owner is the player who brought the card into the game, via Living Wish or a similar effect.
A token's owner is the player under whose control it entered the battlefield.

cards.name: Faerie Macabre
cards.text:
Flying

Discard Faerie Macabre: Exile up to two target cards from graveyards.
cards.originalText:
Flying

Discard Faerie Macabre: Exile up to two target cards from graveyards.
cards.flavor: The line between dream and death is gauzy and fragile. She leads those too near it from one side to the other.

rulings.text: Faerie Macabre's second ability can be activated only while it's in your hand. You can do this any time you could cast an instant.
The targeted cards may be in the same graveyard or in different graveyards.

cards.name: Fleshbag Marauder
cards.text: When Fleshbag Marauder enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.
cards.originalText: When Fleshbag Marauder enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor: Grixis is a world where the only things found in abundance are death and decay. Corpses, whole or in part, are the standard currency among necromancers and demons.

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, you may sacrifice Fleshbag Marauder itself. If you control no other creatures, you'll have to sacrifice Fleshbag Marauder.

cards.name: Garruk Wildspeaker
cards.text:
+1: Untap two target lands.

-1: Put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.

-4: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
+1: Untap two target lands.

-1: Put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.

-4: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

rulings.text: The first ability can target any two lands. They don't have to be tapped.
The third ability affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.
Planeswalkers are permanents. You can cast one at the time you could cast a sorcery. When your planeswalker spell resolves, it enters the battlefield under your control.
Planeswalkers are not creatures. Spells and abilities that affect creatures won’t affect them.

Planeswalkers have loyalty. A planeswalker enters the battlefield with a number of loyalty counters on it equal to the number printed in its lower right corner. Activating one of its abilities may cause it to gain or lose loyalty counters. Damage dealt to a planeswalker causes that many loyalty counters to be removed from it. If it has no loyalty counters on it, it’s put into its owner’s graveyard as a state-based action.

Planeswalkers each have a number of activated abilities called “loyalty abilities.” You can activate a loyalty ability of a planeswalker you control only at the time you could cast a sorcery and only if you haven’t activated one of that planeswalker’s loyalty abilities yet that turn.

The cost to activate a planeswalker’s loyalty ability is represented by a symbol with a number inside. Up-arrows contain positive numbers, such as “+1”; this means “Put one loyalty counter on this planeswalker.” Down-arrows contain negative numbers, such as “-7”; this means “Remove seven loyalty counters from this planeswalker.” A symbol with a “0” means “Put zero loyalty counters on this planeswalker.”
You can’t activate a planeswalker’s ability with a negative loyalty cost unless the planeswalker has at least that many loyalty counters on it.

Planeswalkers can’t attack (unless an effect turns the planeswalker into a creature). However, they can be attacked. Each of your attacking creatures can attack your opponent or a planeswalker that player controls. You say which as you declare attackers.
If your planeswalkers are being attacked, you can block the attackers as normal.
If a creature that’s attacking a planeswalker isn’t blocked, it’ll deal its combat damage to that planeswalker. Damage dealt to a planeswalker causes that many loyalty counters to be removed from it.

If a source you control would deal noncombat damage to an opponent, you may have that source deal that damage to a planeswalker that opponent controls instead. For example, although you can’t target a planeswalker with Shock, you can target your opponent with Shock, and then as Shock resolves, choose to have Shock deal its 2 damage to one of your opponent’s planeswalkers. (You can’t split up that damage between different players and/or planeswalkers.) If you have Shock deal its damage to a planeswalker, two loyalty counters are removed from it.
If a player controls two or more planeswalkers that share a planeswalker type, that player chooses one of them and the rest are put into their owners’ graveyards as a state-based action.

cards.name: Genju of the Cedars
cards.text:
Enchant Forest

{2}: Enchanted Forest becomes a 4/4 green Spirit creature until end of turn. It's still a land.

When enchanted Forest is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Cedars from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText:
Enchant Forest

{2}: Enchanted Forest becomes a 4/4 green Spirit creature until end of turn. It's still a land.

When enchanted Forest is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Cedars from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.name: Genju of the Fens
cards.text:
Enchant Swamp

{2}: Until end of turn, enchanted Swamp becomes a 2/2 black Spirit creature with "{B}: This creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn." It's still a land.

When enchanted Swamp is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Fens from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText:
Enchant Swamp

{2}: Until end of turn, enchanted Swamp becomes a 2/2 black Spirit creature with "{B}: This creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn." It's still a land.

When enchanted Swamp is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Fens from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.originalText: Draw three cards.

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Concentrate.

cards.name: Hideous End
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. Its controller loses 2 life.
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature. Its controller loses 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"A little dark magic won't stop me. The worse the curse, the better the prize."

—Radavi, Joraga relic hunter, last words

rulings.text: If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Hideous End resolves, the entire spell is countered. No one loses life.

When Howling Banshee enters the battlefield, each player loses 3 life.

cards.text:
Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.

Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

Madness {3}{B} (If you discard this card, you may cast it for its madness cost instead of putting it into your graveyard.)

Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

Madness {3}{B} (If you discard this card, you may cast it for its madness cost instead of putting it into your graveyard.)

rulings.text: If you cycle Ichor Slick, you may cast it for its madness cost. You choose whether or not to cast it with madness before you draw a card from the cycling effect.

Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText: When Indrik Stomphowler enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: An indrik's howl has destructive power much subtler than that of its crushing foot.

Flying

cards.originalText:
Flying

When Keening Banshee enters the battlefield, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Her cold wail echoes in the alleys and under-eaves, finding the unfortunate and turning their blood to ice.

cards.name: Krosan Tusker
cards.text:
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

When you cycle Krosan Tusker, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText:
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

When you cycle Krosan Tusker, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability is countered (with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.

cards.name: Lignify
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature is a 0/4 Treefolk with no abilities.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature is a 0/4 Treefolk with no abilities.
cards.flavor: Bulgo paused, puzzled. What was that rustling sound, and why did he feel so stiff? And how could his feet be so thirsty?

rulings.text: Lignify overwrites characteristic-defining abilities that specify the enchanted creature's power or toughness (such as the one Dauntless Dourbark has) or that specify its creature types (such as changeling does).

Lignify will overwrite static abilities that come from the creature itself (such as the one on Verduran Enchantress) because Lignify causes the creature to lose that ability before it gets a chance to apply.
Lignify overwrites previous effects that changed the enchanted creature's creature types. Any such effects that apply after Lignify enters the battlefield will work normally.
Lignify causes the enchanted creature to lose all abilities it had at the time it became enchanted. Any abilities granted to the creature after Lignify entered the battlefield will work normally.
If a previous effect switched the creature's power and toughness, that effect still applies (though it will apply to the creature's new power and toughness).
If the enchanted creature has a characteristic-defining ability that specifies its color, that ability will still have its effect because it's applied before the creature loses the ability.

If Lignify leaves the battlefield, the creature goes back to being what it was before. Any effects that applied while the Lignify was on the battlefield, such as Giant Growth or Lace with Moonglove, will continue to apply.

Lignify will overwrite any previous effects that set the enchanted creature's power or toughness (such as Serendib Sorcerer does). Any such effects that apply after Lignify entered the battlefield will work normally.

Lignify will not overwrite effects such as those from Glorious Anthem, counters, or Giant Growth that change the enchanted creature's power or toughness without setting it to a specific value. Apply such effects after applying Lignify.

cards.name: Liliana Vess
cards.text:
+1: Target player discards a card.

-2: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

-8: Put all creature cards from all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control.
cards.originalText:
+1: Target player discards a card.

-2: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

-8: Put all creature cards in all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control.

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.
Planeswalkers are permanents. You can cast one at the time you could cast a sorcery. When your planeswalker spell resolves, it enters the battlefield under your control.
Planeswalkers are not creatures. Spells and abilities that affect creatures won’t affect them.

Planeswalkers have loyalty. A planeswalker enters the battlefield with a number of loyalty counters on it equal to the number printed in its lower right corner. Activating one of its abilities may cause it to gain or lose loyalty counters. Damage dealt to a planeswalker causes that many loyalty counters to be removed from it. If it has no loyalty counters on it, it’s put into its owner’s graveyard as a state-based action.

Planeswalkers each have a number of activated abilities called “loyalty abilities.” You can activate a loyalty ability of a planeswalker you control only at the time you could cast a sorcery and only if you haven’t activated one of that planeswalker’s loyalty abilities yet that turn.

The cost to activate a planeswalker’s loyalty ability is represented by a symbol with a number inside. Up-arrows contain positive numbers, such as “+1”; this means “Put one loyalty counter on this planeswalker.” Down-arrows contain negative numbers, such as “-7”; this means “Remove seven loyalty counters from this planeswalker.” A symbol with a “0” means “Put zero loyalty counters on this planeswalker.”
You can’t activate a planeswalker’s ability with a negative loyalty cost unless the planeswalker has at least that many loyalty counters on it.

Planeswalkers can’t attack (unless an effect turns the planeswalker into a creature). However, they can be attacked. Each of your attacking creatures can attack your opponent or a planeswalker that player controls. You say which as you declare attackers.
If your planeswalkers are being attacked, you can block the attackers as normal.
If a creature that’s attacking a planeswalker isn’t blocked, it’ll deal its combat damage to that planeswalker. Damage dealt to a planeswalker causes that many loyalty counters to be removed from it.

If a source you control would deal noncombat damage to an opponent, you may have that source deal that damage to a planeswalker that opponent controls instead. For example, although you can’t target a planeswalker with Shock, you can target your opponent with Shock, and then as Shock resolves, choose to have Shock deal its 2 damage to one of your opponent’s planeswalkers. (You can’t split up that damage between different players and/or planeswalkers.) If you have Shock deal its damage to a planeswalker, two loyalty counters are removed from it.
If a player controls two or more planeswalkers that share a planeswalker type, that player chooses one of them and the rest are put into their owners’ graveyards as a state-based action.

cards.name: Mutilate
cards.text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn for each Swamp you control.
cards.originalText: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn for each Swamp you control.
cards.flavor: Liliana developed a fondness for the moment when roaring becomes squealing.

rulings.text: The effect is based on the number of Swamps you control when Mutilate resolves. Only creatures on the battlefield at that time will be affected. The effect won't change later in the turn, even if the number of Swamps you control changes.

cards.name: Nature's Lore
cards.text: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Nature's secrets can be read on every tree, every branch, every leaf.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can find any card with the land type Forest, including Snow-covered Forest or non-Basic lands like Tropical Island, Murmuring Bosk, or Stomping Ground. You can even find a card that is a land in addition to other types, such as Dryad Arbor.

cards.name: Overrun
cards.text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Nature doesn't walk.

rulings.text: Overrun affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.

cards.name: Phyrexian Rager
cards.text: When Phyrexian Rager enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.originalText: When Phyrexian Rager enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor: It takes no prisoners, but it keeps the choicest bits for Phyrexia.

cards.text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
cards.originalText: Plated Slagwurm can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.
cards.flavor: Beneath the Tangle, the wurm tunnels stretch . . . wide as a stone's throw, long as forever, deep as you dare.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Rancor

Enchant creature

Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has trample.

When Rancor is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Rancor to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has trample.

When Rancor is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Rancor to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Hatred outlives the hateful.

rulings.text: If the target of Rancor when it's cast as a spell is an illegal target when Rancor tries to resolve, Rancor will be countered and put into its owner's graveyard. It won't return to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Ravenous Baloth
cards.text: Sacrifice a Beast: You gain 4 life.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a Beast: You gain 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"All we know about the Krosan Forest we have learned from those few who made it out alive."

—Elvish refugee

cards.name: Ravenous Rats
cards.text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
cards.originalText: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor: Nothing is sacred to rats. Everything is simply another meal.

cards.name: Rise from the Grave
cards.text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.
cards.originalText: Put target creature card in a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.
cards.flavor:
"Death is no excuse for disobedience."

—Liliana Vess

rulings.text: Rise from the Grave doesn't overwrite any previous colors or types. Rather, it adds another color and another subtype.
If the targeted creature is normally colorless, it will simply become black. It won't be both black and colorless.

A later effect that changes the affected creature's colors will overwrite that part of Rise from the Grave effect; the creature will be just the new color. The same is true about an effect that changes the affected creature's types or subtypes.
A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

cards.name: Rude Awakening
cards.text:
Choose one — Untap all lands you control; or until end of turn, lands you control become 2/2 creatures that are still lands.

Entwine {2}{G} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
cards.originalText:
Choose one — Untap all lands you control; or until end of turn, lands you control become 2/2 creatures that are still lands.

Entwine {2}{G} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.
Lands that enter the battlefield or otehrwise come under your control after Rude Awakening resolves won't be affected.

cards.name: Serrated Arrows
cards.text:
Serrated Arrows enters the battlefield with three arrowhead counters on it.

At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no arrowhead counters on Serrated Arrows, sacrifice it.

{T}, Remove an arrowhead counter from Serrated Arrows: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
cards.originalText:
Serrated Arrows enters the battlefield with three arrowhead counters on it.

At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no arrowhead counters on Serrated Arrows, sacrifice it.

{T}, Remove an arrowhead counter from Serrated Arrows: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

rulings.text: The upkeep trigger checks the number of counters at the start of upkeep, and only goes on the stack if there are no arrowhead counters at that time. It will check again on resolution, and will do nothing if you've somehow manage to get a new arrowhead counter on the Arrows.

cards.name: Sign in Blood
cards.text: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.
cards.originalText: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"You know I accept only one currency here, and yet you have sought me out. Why now do you hesitate?"

—Xathrid demon

cards.name: Skeletal Vampire
cards.text:
Flying

When Skeletal Vampire enters the battlefield, put two 1/1 black Bat creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.

{3}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a Bat: Put two 1/1 black Bat creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: You may pay the cost of Skeletal Vampire's activated abilities by sacrificing any Bat, not just a Bat token it created.

cards.name: Stampeding Wildebeests
cards.text:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

At the beginning of your upkeep, return a green creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
Trample

At the beginning of your upkeep, return a green creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: The most violent and destructive storms in Femeref occur on cloudless days.

rulings.text: The ability that returns a creature doesn't target anything. You can return a creature with shroud or protection from green, for example. You don't decide which creature to return until the ability resolves. If you control no other green creatures, you must return Stampeding Wildebeests itself.
You choose a creature and return it all during resolution of the triggered ability. This means that if you have two Wildebeests, there is no way to end up returning only one creature.

cards.name: Tendrils of Corruption
cards.text: Tendrils of Corruption deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life, where X is the number of Swamps you control.
cards.originalText: Tendrils of Corruption deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life, where X is the number of Swamps you control.
cards.flavor: Darkness doesn't always send its minions to do its dirty work.

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain is equal to the number of Swamps you control, not the amount of damage Tendrils of Corruption deals (in case some of it is prevented).
If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Tendrils of Corruption would resolve, the entire spell is countered. You won't gain any life.

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition

cards.name: Treetop Village
cards.text:
Treetop Village enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

{1}{G}: Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green Ape creature with trample until end of turn. It's still a land. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
cards.originalText:
Treetop Village enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

{1}{G}: Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green Ape creature with trample until end of turn. It's still a land.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.name: Twisted Abomination
cards.text:
{B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.

Swampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)
cards.originalText:
{B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.

Swampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, Swampcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Swamp card. After you find a Swamp card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Swampcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Swampcycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Swampcycling from being activated.

Swampcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Swampcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose to find any card with the Swamp land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Swamp card in your library.

cards.name: Urborg Syphon-Mage

cards.originalText: {2}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Each other player loses 2 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.
cards.flavor: "I have become a gourmet of sorts. Each soul has its own distinctive flavor. The art is in inviting the right company to the feast."
